args.natural_language_statement: Let G be a group and {N_i}_{i ∈ I} a nonempty family of normal subgroups of G. Prove that the intersection ⋂_{i∈I} N_i is a normal subgroup of G. Do not assume I is countable. End the Lean statement with := by sorry. Use Mathlib import at the top.

history.content: Translate: Prove that the intersection of an arbitrary nonempty collection of normal subgroups of a group is a normal subgroup (do not assume the collection is countable). Save it to Dummit-Foote_exercise_3_1_22b.lean

/-- Prove that the intersection of an arbitrary nonempty collection of normal subgroups of a group is a normal subgroup (do not assume the collection is countable). Save it to Dummit-Foote_exercise_3_1_22b.lean -/
theorem isNormalSubgroup_sInf {G : Type*} [Group G] {S : Set (Subgroup G)} (hS : S.Nonempty) :
  IsNormalSubgroup (sInf S) := sorry"}

open Monoid
open CommMonoid (torsion)
theorem torsion_eq_torsion_submonoid_extracted (G : Type u_1) [CommGroup G] : CommMonoid.torsion G = (CommGroup.torsion G).toSubmonoid := sorry", "explanation": "To translate the informal statement into the given Lean4

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Dummit and Foote, exercise 3.1.22(b).

Let G be a group and S be a nonempty collection of subgroups of G such that every member
of S is normal in G. Then the intersection (infimum) of the subgroups in S is closed under
conjugation by elements of G; in particular it is a normal subgroup. -/
theorem Dummit_Foote_exercise_3_1_22b {G : Type*} [Group G] {S : Set (Subgroup G)} (hne : S.Nonempty)
  (h : ∀ N ∈ S, ∀ g x : G, x ∈ (N : Set G) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ (N : Set G)) :
  ∀ g x, x ∈ (sInf S : Set G) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ (sInf S : Set G) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Dummit and Foote, exercise 3.1.22(b).

Let G be a group and S be a nonempty collection of subgroups of G such that every member
of S is normal in G. Then the intersection (infimum) of the subgroups in S is closed under
conjugation by elements of G; in particular it is a normal subgroup. -/
theorem Dummit_Foote_exercise_3_1_22b {G : Type*} [Group G] {S : Set (Subgroup G)} (hne : S.Nonempty)
  (h : ∀ N ∈ S, ∀ g x : G, x ∈ (N : Set G) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ (N : Set G)) :
  ∀ g x, x ∈ sInf (coe '' S) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ sInf (coe '' S) := by sorry

Let G be a group and S be a nonempty collection of subgroups of G such that every member
of S is normal in G. Then the intersection (infimum) of the subgroups in S is closed under
conjugation by elements of G; in particular it is a normal subgroup. -/

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Dummit and Foote, exercise 3.1.22(b).

Let G be a group and S be a nonempty collection of subgroups of G such that every member
of S is normal in G. Then the intersection (infimum) of the subgroups in S is closed under
conjugation by elements of G; in particular it is a normal subgroup. -/
theorem Dummit_Foote_exercise_3_1_22b {G : Type*} [Group G] {S : Set (Subgroup G)} (hne : S.Nonempty)
  (h : ∀ N ∈ S, ∀ g x : G, x ∈ (N : Set G) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ (N : Set G)) :
  ∀ (g x : G), x ∈ (Set.sInter (coe '' S)) → g * x * g⁻¹ ∈ (Set.sInter (coe '' S)) := by sorry
